intro: Cryptophoranthus, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its unique, showy inflorescences that resemble ghostly apparitions, hence its common name. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and glossy, while the flowers come in shades of purple and pink. Cryptophoranthus is often cultivated for its ornamental value in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
